Reviews.Title: “Ealing Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: One night stay to visit American Embassy.Reception first class, Room was fine and the bed very comfortable. Despite being on the road side there was little noise. If you suffer from vertigo avoid looking out of the windows if you are on an upper floor (The windows are floor to ceiling.There was a very small amount of mould in a corner above the bath. The food in the cafe bar was reasonably good,& the service was fine. Other than these two points it would have been a five rating. The car park is not as small as some reviews have indicated. We found lots of space arriving at 5.30PM and the staff were quite relaxed at my request to stay parked later the following day if we returned late. One of the better Travelodge hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but effective”
Reviews.Author: Lara_Saul
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ealing Travelodge for one night last weekend and it was absolutely fine. There are no bells or whistles, a simple room and bathroom. Plenty of hot water and was perfectly clean. I didn't have breakfast but the cafe area looked nice.

Reviews.Title: “Newish, clean and cheap!”
Reviews.Author: Stokie_on_tour
Reviews.Content: A bracing five minute walk to the tube with good links up to the West end of London, very quiet, very clean and very simple. Plenty of (better) places to eat breakfast in good cafes nearby, if you are looking for budget accommodation near London, this is a great choice. I paid £57 for three nights whilst I was a ta convention in Hammersmith, you can't go wrong if you book well in advance!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: ekeat79
Reviews.Content: This was the second Travelodge hotel that my wife and I stayed during our London trip, the other being at Whetstone. The rooms that we got at both hotels have exactly the same layout, therefore you will see similar reviews from me for both hotels. To put it simply, this is one budget hotel that has everything you would want but may not be available in other similar hotels: value for money, cleanliness/tidiness, spaciousness, and even good food! The room consists of a queen-sized bed, a writing table, and a TV, with ample walking space in between. There is no wardrobe in the room (only a compartment with hangers), but this was not a big issue for us. There is also a bathroom in each room, but without soap and toiletries. Coffee and tea-making facilities are also available. We did not have our breakfast at this hotel as we had already tried the food at Whetstone. However, we know that this hotel provides good English breakfast, buffet-style. Similar to the Whetstone hotel, this hotel also requires a 10-min walk from the nearest tube station. However, if you could do with the walking, then you should find this hotel a good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Our 4 night break at Ealing Travelodge February 2012”
Reviews.Author: Whiteley-family
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived home from a 4 night break at this travelodge. I must admit before I travel I regularly go on this website to check out the accommodation . I am really shocked how some people have rated it! Our family were very impressed with the facilities. Yes, there is limited parking, however we arrived at midday and there was plently of room. The car park is also very secure and costs only £5 per day. The staff were very friendly and helpful. When we booked into our room there wasn't enough bed linen, however I went down to reception and within 5 minutes we had more than enough bedlinen. Our room was really warm, too warm in fact that we had to turn the heating off! The room was clean and the double bed was spacious. The only downside is the sofa bed (not very comfortable), but we are regular campers and took a self inflating air bed for our girls to sleep on. The bathroom was clean, a little on the smallside but adequate. We had clean towels everyday and the beds were also made for us. We didn't use the onsite restuarant, however it looked very clean. The tube is only about a 10 minute walk up the high street and there are plenty of shops. It was very safe. All in all if you are looking for a break away and want to visit the London sites I would definitely recommend this travelodge.

Reviews.Title: “A very dull hotel”
Reviews.Author: Simon D
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly new Travelodge in Ealing. I know Travelodge are aimed at the budget end but the rooms are extremely dull and lifeless. for £ 89.00 this was over priced. This particular one is as lifeless as an ETAP (just bigger rooms) and believe me ETAP is pretty bad. The room and bathroom was clean and everything appeared to work (except BBC 1 on the TV). The service on reception and in the bar / restaurant was very polite and the food was acceptable. The duvet is flatter than an A4 sheet of paper but this is common in all Travelodge’s lately. However the problems are: The walls are as thin as the duvet which means you can hear things you really don’t want to hear when staying on your own in a hotel. Doors banging outside are loud and echo and they bang at 3:00am in the morning. At somewhere around 6:00am a generator comes on and stays on - it is loud so ask for a room at the front of the hotel. And if you are at the back, open the curtains and hey - a lovely brick wall - so pleasant !!! For me - I know its London but this hotel is not worth £ 89.00. I would rather drive up the Travelodge on the M4 Reading and pay half that ! I will only stay there again in an emergency. If you are in no hurry, wait for the new Premier Inn opening Spring 2012. It is literally across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Freezing Cold Room”
Reviews.Author: binkie
Reviews.Content: Booked three family rooms for the 28th Jan 2012 large family gathering at a local restaurant. My room did not have a radiator (room 213) but air con. Told reception it was really cold and was told to put the aircon onto the SUN SIGN and it would be warm in ten mins. The air con box on the wall was hanging off and not working. We had spread out all over the room with our posh clothes, makeup and jewellery ready to wear to go out with for a surprise party and did not have time to change rooms, not that i was offered one. We froze... Parking very secure IF you could get one of the spaces, no where else to park.... car park in Arden Road was a long walk away. Room very clean, needed the hot bath to thaw out in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Would certainly use again”
Reviews.Author: saxie
Reviews.Content: Clean, new, and felt safe. Limited car parking but we arrived about 15-00 and had no problems. The car park is security protected and we felt very confident leaving the car there. The walk to the Tube station is main road with great shops and we felt fine at midnight walking it. Friendly and helpful receptionists. Our double room was tiny compared to some other Travelodges but everything we needed was there, and I bet most guests use a shower rather than a bath. I liked the room. We didn't use the on site catering as we had other plans but it looked fine. Recognising there is the usual basic storage (great on a one night stay to prevent leaving belongings behind) I could happily stay here for a few days as a base for a visit to London.

Reviews.Title: “Need to clean properly”
Reviews.Author: Tiptoptim-brum
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed at the Ealing Travelodge and although they are basic and do what they say on the tin, I was absolutely discussed by two things. One finding a massive amount of hair down the bathroom plug hole which meant that it took over 5 mins to empty. This repulsed me and I wish that I had complained about this now. The second and petty complaint was the congealed breakfast. As I am a vegetarian the only hot food was toast, tomatoes and the worst scrambled egg that I have ever tasted because it had been kept under a heat lamp. I will never touch that again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient but has limited parking”
Reviews.Author: phillip1907
Reviews.Content: Ealing is a good location for either getting to central London (20 mins on Tube) and to Heathrow (via Heathrow Connect). The staff were very helpful and friendly. The room was clean and tidy but a little sparsely furnished as is the norm with new Travelodges - no drawers and limited hanging space would be inconvenient if stopping more than a day or two. Limited car parking is an issue (approx 8 non-disabled spaces) and would be a consideration when deciding whether to stop here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is great for a Travelodge!”
Reviews.Author: GinaRibena
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to beat about the bush ;-) we use this local hotel when we want to get away from the children and animals for a 'just you and me' night..and without having to pack up the car, drive for hours, or... forget passports, get overtired on long haul, take out life insurance..make massive arrangements (funeral.. if the journey is horrendous etc ;)...picture painted? Travelodge frequently have sales that have £10/£12 rooms, even at weekends! (register and they pre warn you when they are going to start) which is astounding for one of the most visited capital cities of the world! Without a doubt, Central London IS stunning! I watched this hotel being built in 2010, at the time I was working in a building diagonally opposite it... and it is still in pristine condition. Crisp, clean rooms, great size, no views but ermmmm we don't stay in hotels to stand at the windows all day and night!! (Dunno about you guys??) ;) No SKY/Freeview, but about 11/13 channels on flat screen TV, fixed on the wall at the end of the bed..Excellent!. Room cold? Turn on the little heaters, room is soon toastie warm. Bathroom clean. Lush double shower. Bring your own bathing products, which is no hassle when you can buy travel size everything anyway. Bed's..We sleep like babies! (Hotel is very sound proofed...Mr Sleep lives here!) This hotel is economy concious, which a good thing for the world and great for the low prices! The staff (\o Hi Gina..Hi Guys) are friendly and more than helpful and polite. If you want or need anything extra (pillows, tea, sugar, milk etc) you just ask! (It's not rocket science, their training didn't include 'mind reading!), they are MORE than happy to accommodate you. Arriving late? There is a snacks vending machine in reception. If you can't/don't want to get anything to eat at the hotel.. A short walk either way on the Uxbridge Road will bring you to 24hr shops/supermarkets, and various restaurants/fast food outlets open until 2am+. Lots of local pizza places will deliver to the hotel. Staff can provide the numbers or search on your phone or laptop..Wifi free.. and works perfectly! Parking is at a premium in London, so good advice to pre book a car parking space when you are booking your room...that goes for any hotel you want to park your car at in London.If you need to take your car..you need to take your car!. If you need to pay, well pay then! Travelodge only charge when there is little space for parking on their hotel sites. So it's not that there 'money grabbing' about it..What's £5 anyway when the room is dirt cheap??. Trust me, go check out a Central London hotel's parking rates...Ooooohhh it's painful!!. The Ealing Travelodge is located perfectly, and is lucky to have an amazing historical park behind it's hotel, called Walpole Park, which has a fab jazz festival in August! The shopping centre's aren't too bad, (they used to be better but Westfields has killed a lot of local shopping centre's), but they have cute markets within the shopping centre, on certain days, and lots of different, very good restaurants to eat at dotted all over Ealing, turn right out of the hotel and you are spoilt for choice within minutes. Read up about this area before you stay, we have quite a few interesting places to visit. Hotel in a safe area you may wonder??? Well the police station is 2 doors away to the right, so that's a comfort. :o) but I would be very guarded when you walk about, especially at night, be aware, stay safe, don't do stupid things and you should be fine, but that's common sense for every City isn't it? Train station about a 6 minute walk away, turn right out of the hotel. The station has no parking. Overland trains into Paddington and Central London is a 40 minute tube journey. Westfield delicious Shopping Centre is 20 minutes or so. As Ealing Broadway is the first/last stop on the Central Line. You ALWAYS get a seat at least into London...if you get one back ..feel lucky, but once the train returning to Ealing Broadway goes overground at White City~Which is where Westfields is, you get a seat. Bus stops are not far from the hotel going either way. Ealing has fantastic access into, and out of London. Heathrow is about a £30 cab ride away. Don't forget this is a budget hotel, but the Ealing Travelodge feels like a home from home for us..We are already booked for twice in January!!. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location clean and newish.”
Reviews.Author: sdicb02
Reviews.Content: Being only a ten minute walk from Ealing Broadway tube station (Central line), and well located for shops, I would recommend for a cheap London Hotel. As we only paid £15, I thought everything was great for the money. Room was spotless and the staff helpful. The hotel has either been recently refurbished or is quite new. Arrived at 3:00 PM and got a parking spot (Parking limited) so get there ASAP - Cost £5 - Bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but Fine (again!!)”
Reviews.Author: WiganTony
Reviews.Content: Would echo the views of others. Functional and clean rooms (ours was at the front overlooking Ealing Broadway), pleasant staff who were more than happy to supply additional bedding, towels etc, and minimal noise from other guests despite us being near to the lifts. We managed to book one of the Saver rates at around £30/night for our three nights, so more than happy with the standard of accommodation for this price albeit recognising that this is a fairly new hotel. We found it easy to drive to (off the M40/A40) BUT be warned - very limited parking on-site. We arrived at 11:30 on a Sunday morning and managed to get a space for three days, but there are only around a dozen places the bulk of which are blue badge spaces. Not sure where the staff would direct you to alternative parking, but having had a look myself, it seems that around £10 per day is the going rate in the area. As we were using the hotel as a base for visiting Central London, it was ideally located for Ealing Broadway station (10 minutes walk) and Central/District line trains. We purchased an Oyster Card each and topped up with £20 - more than enough for our trips into London and a few bus rides in the capital itself. However, be aware that Ealing Broadway is not a London Underground operated station, so to get a refund on the Oyster Card (deposit plus unused cash value) you do need to visit a LU station. We ended up cashing in our Oyster Cards at a Central London station then paid the standard single fare back to Ealing Broadway on our final night. We didn't eat in the hotel, but there are a number of restaurants around the Ealing Broadway Centre area - we ate at Pizza Express. Also a number of places to get breakfast on the way to the station if you are travelling into London. The only major issue we found with the hotel is that it is on the departure flight path from Heathrow, so aircraft are flying low over the building from early morning until late in the night. Other than that, it's a Travelodge...!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A disgrace”
Reviews.Author: Stass2003
Reviews.Content: I booked my parents into the Ealing Travelodge from Wednesday the 19th of October to Sunday the 23rd of October, paying, in advance, a total of £262 plus another £53.20 for breakfast. My parents drove up to London from Devon, a 4 hour trip, on the Wednesday night after work and arrived at your hotel at around 23.30. On arrival they were told that your hotel was full and that “they had been trying to call all day”, they were then told to wait for a taxi that would take them to another hotel at London Heathrow, 20 miles away! They were also told that on arrival back in Ealing the following morning that they would be shown to their room “immediately” and be able to unpack etc. It seems this “overbooking” is common practice, what a disgrace. Having checked my emails, home answer phone, my work voicemail and my mobile voicemail it is very clear that no one tried to call me prior to my parents arriving. The room at Heathrow that my parents were put in was an absolute disgrace, my Mother took pictures it was so bad, she informed me she didn’t put her bag on the floor as it was so dirty and that the single curtain in the room was attached with one curtain hook and one shower curtain plastic hook, 2 in total. It sounds like the staff put my parents in a room usually use by staff or storing furniture. After my parents were ferried back to Ealing the next morning they went to check into their room, as promised at midnight the night before, only to be told that was not possible and that they would have to “come back later”. To say I am upset about the treatment of my parents would be an understatement. There is a Premier Inn being built across the road from this awful hotel, hopefully it will be better.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but fine for London”
Reviews.Author: Monty2212
Reviews.Content: Travelodge is fine. I'd call it to the Ryanair of Hotels - cheap and basic where you have to pay for every little extra (like checking in before 3pm!). Our friend's room stank of smoke which was pretty awful. Our room was fine & as it's London, you spend little time in the room anyway. I would recommend this hotel if you're just looking for a cheap & cheerful base. The location is great and Ealing is fantastic - lots of nice restaurants, bars, shops & great tube line.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Travelodge!!!”
Reviews.Author: MrYogi1964
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and is one of the quietest and cleanest Travelodges I have stayed in. Sure there is no telephone in the room .... its a Travelodge, Yes there were only one set of towels on the first day, but a visit to reception and the extra set of towels arrived within 15 minutes and there were 2 sets from then on ...its a Travelodge. Staff were very pleasant and helpful and arranging taxis or giving directions was no problem. Breakfast was typical Travelodge breakfast ...its a Travelodge Ealing Broadway tube station is a 5 - 10 minute walk or £4 in a taxi, walking past many shops and resturaunts. Tube takes about 25 minutes to reach central london on the Central line and tubes are very regular at the station.

Reviews.Title: “Do You Expect 1st class in Ryanair?”
Reviews.Author: Leszek S
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from 4 days stay in the Ealing Travelodge. I am reading the "Terribles""Poors, " and simply do not understand: - no amenities or no phone - didn't you people read about in on their website? I did so there is no surprise for me. - one towel set.... I've just asked for an extra sheet and received a huge plastic bag with extra quilt, pillow etc. No charge, not any word. Tip: just try to ask, not harmful at all. Now a summary in short words: + nice location, maybe not in the centre, but taking in consideration availability of familily rooms its a good location (two bus stops from Underground, the stops are just outside hotel) - the sofa is maybe for one person, but not for 2 children (too hard) ++ fresh, clean, new premises (tough to find in London) + good daily service, the teas and coffies replaced daily - terrible breakfast - if anyone consider (its always better to eat outside) - no full wardrobe But - price/value is a pro. You just get what you pay, in case of this hotel this is a nice "get"

Reviews.Title: “Stay here while it is still new!”
Reviews.Author: MikeWReading
Reviews.Content: All the usual features of a Travelodge (i.e. sparse furnishings, plastic chair, no toiletries except a tiny bar of soap, very small bath, silly headboards with just a small hole for your alarm clock etc) but it's nice and new so they haven't had time yet not to maintain it properly. Also, it's actually got quite good sound insulation so even in a room facing the main road there was little noise. Mr Sleep must have done his job here, unlike most other Travelodges I have stayed at. Ten minutes walk to Ealing Broadway station - unfortunately First Great Western trains from there are rubbish, but if you don't mind a lot of stops it's at the end of the Central Line and the frequent tube trains to town pass through Westfield Shopping Centre, For £10 this was a bargain. But it's unlikely you'll get it for that rate - so do shop around as Travelodge is the RyanAir of the hotel world. As one other reviewer says, if you can get a room at Premier Inn for a reasonable price, I'd choose them every time as their standards are far higher.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: samurai86
Reviews.Content: Ok ok, before staying at this hotel - I was in two minds simply because of the reviews on here. Oh boy, how picky are people. This is a GREAT hotel, its fresh (in a sense its a new building) and possibly the best Travelodge i've ever stayed in. The lighting in the hallways is pretty slick - as you walk, they turn on - even the Crowne Plaza and Holiday Inn didn't have the kind of interior did. So I was in London for a few days and stayed in three hotels. Crowne Plaza was first and of course that was going to be a pleasurable stay with great beds, room luxurious etc. Next up was Holiday Inn express was next and was okay (free breakfast ftw). Could compare it with Travelodge as it was that kinda level in terms of room size. Travelodge Ealing was the last hotel I was going to be staying in during my trip in London and to be honest, i wasn't looking forward to it - judging by the comments on here. It was an excellent stay, FREE wifi (even the Crowne Plaza and Holiday Inn didn't provide) plus there was a new lounge/food area beside the reception which 'looked' very slick. The rooms were great, simple and basic. of course no toilettries were given, just the soap... but then again this is expected of a budget hotel. Bed was great, room decor was nice with orange lighting behind the bed. Carpets, sheets and towels were nice and fresh. I don't know what else to say but i will be coming back here. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from the nearest station (ealing broadway - walk out the station, take a left, take a right at the traffic lights and walk for 10 mins and you'll see it on the left hand side beside office blocks and a police station). Plenty of well known brands and stores around the travelodge - M&S, McDonalds, Starbucks, shopping centre, Sainsburys, Boots, Greggs etc. A lot of late night takeaways too!

Reviews.Title: “Take ear plugs & expect basic”
Reviews.Author: Emma R
Reviews.Content: We stayed on Sunday 4th and Monday 5th Sep 2011. On the positive, this hotel is in a good location and everything is still in pretty new condition. However, as soon as the Premier Inn being built opposite opens, we would stay there first every time. The rooms are fairly small and sparse but we found this ok since everything still felt new and clean. Did think cost cutting had gone a bit far as other reviews have mentioned. For example, no shelf in the shower was a pain as was no phone in the room and no lock on the bathroom door. Also only provided one spare pillow between two to supplement the thin ones on the bed and (as mentioned by others) only got one set of towels. Noise was the thing we struggled with most. Maybe if you are a really sound, heavy sleeper you would be fine, but we clearly are not! Why the doors couldn't have been fitted with soft closers we couldn't understand (more cost cutting?)?!?! They slammed all night. Also the room we had on the first night faced onto the car park barrier. Everytime a new guest arrived (into the small hours) it buzzed and creaked open then clanked closed. Also, there is an intercom on the car park barrier and we could hear every word. After very little sleep on the first night we asked to change rooms at reception. Again, as mentioned in other reviews, the lady on reception, although she did arrange a room change, was not friendly or even polite. She silently tapped away on the computer for several minutes then gave us a new key card. We understand the noise wasn't her fault, and maybe she's not the happiest in her job, but just a hint of helpfulness makes the world a better place. It's up to you, you know what you are getting with a Travelodge. Inexpensive, basic, and in this case - noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare... never stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller1703_76
Reviews.Content: We decide to stay at the Ealing Travelodge for a week towards the end of July as we were between flats. On calling them they told us they could not accept bookings over the telephone and only on the internet, this was not too much of a problem for us but for the older generation it could be a problem. On checking in we informed them we have 2 books, 1 for the Sunday night and 1 for Monday to Friday. The reception person said no problems leave it with me to book you in, give us our keys and told us we were on the 3rd floor. Sunday nights sleep was fine except the constant slamming of doors, but at the end of the day your in a hotel so you have to expect it. The room we had, consisted of only 1 set of towels for 2 people! On the Monday night we were in bed and 3 random people walked into our room with another key... NOT VERY GOOD. In the morning I talked to the front receptionist for 30 mins and she explained that our room had been reallocated as we had not checked in????? Then she went on to tell me our room keys had been reset and we had to pay for the whole week. How nice is that. I, like a fool, paid for the rest of the week and accepted her apologies. As it turns out or new flat was ready so we checked out on the Wednesday morning and they told me that they would give me a refund for the 2 days which we did not stop in the hotel.... As of yet and hours on the telephone, emails and visits I still have not had a a refund. The manager never returns my calls and now they are saying they have no record of my stay.... To say this is a new hotel is a joke.. the room had loads of faults, lights not working and marks / scraps on the walls. The rooms are very spars as well... not wardrobes here! The maid when she bothered to clean our room insisted on putting out 1 set of towels so we were constantly going to the reception to ask for more. BTW they have no phone in the rooms to call the reception. I would not stay here ever again and never recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Can't see what the proble is”
Reviews.Author: bru1955
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay here prior to going to Heathrow as we knew that the tube went from Northfields or South Ealing and it was easier than getting up in the early of the morning to travel from home. We found the rooms perfectly acceptable - what do some people want for the money they pay? The check in staff were very friendly and the breakfast was more than adequate. Will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Pied a terre for a trip to the West End”
Reviews.Author: HeatherandChris
Reviews.Content: The hotel lies on the main road through Ealing and Southall. A 10 minute walk gets you to the Underground which can spirit you away direct to the West End shows. The carpark it boasts is small and most spaces are disabled-dedicated so dont count on getting in. Alternatives are unknown to us. Its very tight but it seems secure enough. The Hotel is clean and tidy throughout. Most staff members were pleasant and helpful, except for the lady cleaning the room in the morning who appeared to have her own agenda into which guests did not fit. The room was a huge disappointment. minimalist may well be in, but it bordered on unfurnished to the amateur eye. We had a family room and it was spacious but seemed spartan, with solely one chair and a smaller than normal dressing table. Wardrobe and clothes facilities were extremely reduced to what I would normally expect. The bathroom/toilet was adequate if not a little cramped, especially for those of larger proportions such as myself. the most striking feature of the room was the floor to ceiling frosted window, which permitted reduced light to enter but did not afford a view. The room therefore felt somewhat claustrophobic despite its large size. We had breakfast there and whilst the cooked menu omitted some of the normal items it was well presented and of reasonable quality. The continental menu looked to expected standards. All in all teh hotel did what we wanted from it, acting as a base for our excursion. That made it satisfacory. We woudl have been unable to spend much time in the room in daylight hours because of the window. We are assured that only the rooms atthe back that directly overlook residents are so equipped. At the front there is the main road and I cannot comment on traffic noise. As in all things, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Good value stay”
Reviews.Author: twist27
Reviews.Content: Prices vary depending when you book but if you can get the cheaper rate this is a bargain. The hotel is a 5-10 minute walk from Ealing Broadway train and underground station. The staff were polite and friendly. The room was clean and has TV and tea and coffee making facilities and the bathroom was small but clean with a good shower (bring your own shower gel ). Breakfast is serve yourself with tea, coffee, juice, fruit, a good selection of cereal and cooked breakfast. Ealing itself has plenty of shops, bars and eateries and makes a good base from which it easy to get to central London.

Reviews.Title: “Atrocious staff. Impolite, unfriendly and incompetant.”
Reviews.Author: nat1962
Reviews.Content: Travelodge seriously needs to review its recruitment and training processes if it believes the standard of staff employed at this branch is adequate. I see from other comments that Ophelia has already been mentioned for her unpleasantness and I can only add incompetance to her list of attributes. Having stayed here for one night I unfortunately left my mobile charger in the room. Ophelia, who never returns calls, eventually contacted the housekeeper who had found it and reluctantly agreed to post it to me (for which I was grateful) providing if I ever stayed in a Travelodge again I wouldn't expect the same service! Needless to say it was never sent and after telephoning 4 times and leaving messages I gave up and bought a new one. Budget hotel with budget staff and although the accommodation is adequate I wouldn't stay here again because all hotels should provide helpful and pleasant staff willing to help should a problem arise. Premier Inn every time from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Minimal”
Reviews.Author: Loobee88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Travelodge thinking it was the safest option as you never know what you might get with private hotels, but we were a bit disappointed. We traveled from Manchester to see a concert in Hyde Park at 3pm so we arrived at 1:30pm understanding that check in was 3pm but asked if it was possible to check in. We were told there is a £10 charge to check in early, to save the extra cash I said we will wait until we get back from the concert at round 10pm but got told we wouldn't have a room then! I had already pre paid for the room so couldn't understand why this was. The abrupt receptionist said 'It's just the way it is'. She said THEY NEVER CLOSE THEIR ONLINE BOOKING SYSTEM! So thay can receive booking after booking online even if they're full which I find bizzare. So reluctantly we paid the £10 to check in early. This was after waiting nearly 15 minutes at reception as there was a sign up saying 'The receptionist is working in another department, please press buzzer for attention', we pressed 3 times and by this time there were 6 other people waiting behind us. Got to the room, there was no shower gel, no shampoo, 2 plastic cups in the bathroom, no shelves for your clothes, a pole sticking out the wall to hang your clothes on, I know it sounds petty but no shelf in the shower to put soap, shower gel ect. on. Although I found an empty bottle of shampoo from the Ramada on the floor in bathroom... I had a shower in the morning and realized there was only one towel, so thought I would give reception a call to ask for another, but there was no phone in the room. So had to go downtairs from the 5th floor to ask. When we checked out the there was no receptionist again so just left our key on the desk. The only good this about this hotel is it is central, free (limited) parking and the bar is open to 1am. I hope whoever reads this finds it helpful. As this is the first review I have ever left on Tripadvisor, I just found it necessary to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service, very rude and unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Bness-Traveller
Reviews.Content: The new Travelodge in Ealing was conveniently situated next door to my office - so, rather stupidly, I booked and paid for it in advance. BIG mistake - they treat you like prisoner here! No amenities, no services and, to top it all, the staff here seems to believe that customer service is optional! The staff here (especially the morning staff named Ophelia and John) seem to be recruited out of a prison-warden school. Very rude and unhelpful - let alone going out to their way, the staff here make it seem like they are doing you a great and personal favour for even things that every single other hotel in the world happily do for you. If you complain, they threaten to throw you out of the hotel if you do not shut-up! If you ask them for a manager to complain to, they shout at you! Indeed, the ability to shout at paying customers seems to be one of the qualifications they look for here! And it was not just me - When I was there, the staff was also shouting at a disabled person, who they had unceremoniously roused out of bed early in the morning and then completely abandoned outdoors (over his car - which was parked, with full permission, outside the hotel). The chap was very stressed and the staff were very uncaring - let alone an apology, they did not even bother to be polite over their mistake. If you are only looking for a bed for a night (no expectations of other things like food/service/politeness/or anything else a hotel is supposed to provide), then this might be fine - for a more hotel-like experience look elsewhere. If you have any special need - a family, children, disability, etc - this is the worst place for you to stay (indeed, they consider customer service a special need here!)

Reviews.Title: “Great area, new hotel, just shame about the view”
Reviews.Author: Cumbrialady
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in early April the day after it opened. Was lovely and clean, and room was small but comfortable. I found the staff to all be from other countries or not good English speaking, so when I had questions and issues with check in it was a bit of a drama - but easily resolved :). My only other complaint was that we were in a double room, and the view was of literally a brick wall - nothing else. Being from the countryside and not used to built up areas I was even more shocked haha! I went to reception to ask to move room, this had to be done the following day and I got moved into a room with a view of an office block so I guess it's just one of them issues! I only asked to move purely because I felt I was getting no fresh air and quite clostrophobic. I didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment on that. There is a shopping centre, KFC, Mcds, Nandos etc all in walking distance and some lovely restaurants. About a 5-10 min walk away from the nearest tube. There is also about a 5 min walk to Iceland and Sainsburys if you run out of anything. All in all a great hotel, with great location and links, just a shame about communication issues and the brick wall!

Reviews.Title: “Small room, even smaller view”
Reviews.Author: pbiggles
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel, but rooms smaller than usual. View was of brick wall about 4ft away. Car park spaces very small although we were lucky to get one at all as there were very few for the number of rooms. Cheap stay, but not my favourite Travelodge

Reviews.Title: “Very good travelodge - usual standards”
Reviews.Author: AnthonyDuffy
Reviews.Content: Very good Travelodge opposite Craven Road in Ealing next to Police Station. Its fairly new and everything was to the usual Travelodge standards. There was an LG LCD TV, Hangers near the door, Air conditioning and a Sofa Bed in the Family Room as well as Tea and Coffee making facilities. Had a restful sleep and the bed was comfy. Our room 402 overlooked the front of the hotel and even though its on the main road was not noisy at all. The 4th floor was actually quite high up. I cant comment on the food as I never used the restaurant but there is a cafe behind reception. There is a computerised check in desk in reception which I found handy for checking in quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, I guess but if a Premier Inn nearby choose that”
Reviews.Author: jfklhr_s
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights recently. Good location. Excellent bus and train connections. Nandos, McDs, KFC and many banks in walking distance. However the rooms are on the smaller size and shower is not very powerful seems to spray more water out of the shower than in. Check out time is 12, but cleaners knock from 10 asking when you plan to leave and then will knock again to ask if your ready to leave. Whereas PI has freeview, TL has 18 channels inclusive of 3 radio and one subtitled. Also the beds are very soft and bedding is very big for the bed. This was my first time in a TL and I would be happy to pay the little more for PI as the guaranteed good night sleep and the powerful shower is an important factor for myself. Luckily a PI is being built across the road.

HotelInfo.Name: Travelodge London Ealing
HotelInfo.Address: 77 Uxbridge Road, London W5 5ST, England
